result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy Lynn Kerbel

records.addlTxt: Certificate of Compliance with Victim Rights

03:39 PM Defendant, Amy Lynn Kerbel, appeared with Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State. 5 cases called. Atty Schmidt recites the agreement plead to 2 counts of bail jump 16CM 48 - no abusive contact, AODA, Plq form filed. The Court examines Def. it is her signature on the 2nd page. She understands the form completely, understands the charges she is pleading to, no drugs or alcohol w/in the last 24 hours. She understands the constitutional rights she is waiving today. She believes the State has enough evidence to prove her guilt beyond a reasonable doubt. She admits to bond violations, in 17CM156 she didn't come to court, in 16CM48 she violated her bond by driving w/out a license. She understands the citizenship laws. She understands that the Court is not bound by the agreement of the parties. she understands DRI charges. In the 2 cases she admits the facts are accurate. In Count 3 of 16CM48 and Count 1 of 17CM156 the Def. enters guilty pleas. The Court finds FB for pleas and JOC to be entered today. All other charges are DRI. The State enters argument for acceptance of these pleas. Atty Schmidt also enters argument for the acceptance of these pleas. Defendant declines aloq. The Court orders 1 yr prob. No op.ABOSB No abusive contact, AODA, 6 months as Imposed Stayed Sentence concur $443./per count. $25/month Friday @ 4 to report to prob.
Plea hearing on December 12, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant, Amy Lynn Kerbel, appeared with Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State. 5 cases called. Atty Schmidt updates the Court, requests plea hearing. Bond to continue.
